text: [Music]
hey friends and Rachna and a back with a
new lesson in today's lesson I will
teach you how to make suggestions and
recommendations using different sentence
structures okay so we'll start with the
first one you can make a suggestion or a
recommendation
using what about or how about now this
is a form of a question okay so for
example there for you let's see how we
can use what about or how about when you
make a suggestion or a recommendation in
my first example what about going to the
new restaurant okay so we say okay like
I mean you know you friends are planning
to go for dinner where should we go
so your friend tells you hey how about
going to the new restaurant or what
about going to the new restaurant
okay now the sentence structure is you
use what about then you use a gerund
when I hope you remember we've learnt
about gerund so during the ing form of
verbs but they're actually not works
they are known as non verbs okay so you
say what about going to the new
restaurant okay when you're making a
suggestion or you can even say what
about the new restaurant okay so you
have two ways of saying it what about
going to the new restaurant or what
about the new restaurant you don't use
the gerund
you can just use the noun okay same way
in my next example how about so now
let's learn how do we use make a
suggestion using how about how about
pasta okay say mother asked you what
should I cook for dinner today so you
said how about pasta you're making a
suggestion to her to make pasta you
you're you are using the known you can
also say how about making pasta so you
can use the gerund ing that's how about
making pasta okay now these two are
interchangeable you can say what about
making pasta
about pasta tonight okay so they're
interchangeable just remember you can
use what about or how about with the
gerund or directly then um alright
friends let's take a look at few more
examples
what about warming leftovers okay so you
all you can say what about the leftovers
you know my told me eat them so what
about warming your I have used the
gerund
well if you don't want to you can just
say what about the leftovers in my next
example how about watching the match
tonight okay so what should we watch
tonight on television so you say okay
how about watching the match tonight
making a suggestion you can say how
about the match tonight
okay your I've used the gerund but again
you are free to drop the gerund and just
use the noun okay so I hope these two
structures are very clear to you what
about and how about when you make
recommendations or suggestions so now
let's take a look at some more sentence
structures on how to use or how to make
suggestions and recommendations okay my
next structure is why don't so now you
say okay where should we go tonight why
don't we try the new Chinese restaurant
friends this is very important when you
make a suggestion
using Y please remember it is always in
the negative and negative present okay
you cannot say why didn't we try that
means it's past and you're asking a
question you're not making a suggestion
so whenever you make a suggestion or a
recommendation starting with Y remember
always it goes at the negative unlike
you know how about and what about that
we just learnt earlier it does not go in
the negative
but with Y after while you always say
why don't we try the new Chinese
restaurant okay my next example why
doesn't she go on a diet what my friends
put on a lot of weight you know and
she's cribbing all the time so I said
why don't you go on a diet
yeah I'm making her a suggestion so
doesn't now why doesn't because it's the
third person which we always use does or
doesn't he she it
I you don't he she it doesn't we don't
they don't so because I'm talking about
a third person who's my friend I say why
doesn't she go on a diet okay now please
remember you can even use how about a
what about they interchange but like I
said so you can say how about trying the
new Chinese restaurant or how about the
new Chinese restaurant okay or what
about going on a diet okay now the next
is let's we use this when we make a
recommendation and of course you're part
of it because this is a contraction of
let us so what do we do now you're
getting bored okay let's take a walk at
the beach all right or let's go for a
picnic so again this is a type or
another way to make a recommendation or
a suggestion you can also say why don't
we take a walk at the beach but remember
to put it in negative or you can say why
don't we go for a picnic tomorrow
alright so when you use Y please
remember
put in negative and all these four
sentence structures are interchangeable
but please remember to use them
correctly all right
